results.title: Power and terror: Noam Chomsky in our times
results.brief_description: A series of lectures by eminent American expert on foreign policy, Noam Chomsky, are centred around the issues of September 11 - the United States’ response to the disaster, as well as the Government’s participation in terrorism. Chomsky displays his signature articulation and intelligence in these illuminating pieces, providing a complex picture of world politics. He deftly places the terrorist attacks in the context of American foreign intervention throughout the decades: for example in Vietnam, Central America and the Middle East. In stark and uncompromising terms Chomsky presents his views that challenge widely held perceptions about America’s motivations, in a refreshingly composed and astute way. Some lectures include question and answer forums with the audience.

results.title: The Corporation
results.creator_credit: Jennifer Abbott, Mark Achbar, Bart Simpson and Big Picture Media Corporation
results.brief_description: Entertaining, illuminating and exhaustively researched Canadian documentary about the rise in power and stature of corporations, and the impact felt throughout the world. Many topics are examined over the course of this work including exploitation of developing countries, company fraud, environmental impact of business on the natural world, business ethics, corporate espionage, media power, censorship, globalisation, marketing manipulation, privatisation and protests. Featuring a wide array of interviews, witty graphics and a soothing voice-over, the filmmakers succeed in making the complexities of the issues at play here understood whilst enrapturing the audience. Winner of the Best Documentary World Cinema Audience Award at the 2004 Sundance Film Festival. Interviewees include: Naomi Klein, Michael Moore and Noam Chomsky.

results.title: Springtime in a small town = Xiao cheng zhi chun
results.creator_credit: Tian Zhuangzhuang, Bill Kong, Li Xiaowan, Ting Yatming, Beijing Film Studio and China Film Group Corporation
results.brief_description: Finely crafted romantic drama about a young married woman who dutifully cares for her sickly husband, but whose feelings for a former beau reawakens her desire. Set amid the post-WW2 ruins of a small town, this film exquisitely portrays Yuwens longing, which contrasts with her efficient but cold care of her ailing and ill-tempered husband. Director Tian Zhuangzuang (The Blue kite), part of the fifth generation of Chinese filmmakers observes his protagonists through doorways and windows, providing an apt metaphor for their inability to connect. A film that allows the tension to build in a languid but effective manner, as the three angst ridden players make their choices. Cast includes Hu Jingfan, Wu Jun, Xin Baiqing, Ye Xiaokeng and Lu Sisi.

results.title: Amandla! A revolution in four-part harmony
results.creator_credit: Lee Hirsch, Desiree Markgraaf, Sherry Simpson, Bomb, Cinemax Reel Life, Ford Foundation, Kwela Productions and South African Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Celebratory, but also poignant, documentary about the history of South African apartheid, as seen through the eyes of numerous black South African musicians and artists. Interviews are interwoven with footage from the 1940s and beyond — footage that portrays the awful discrimination and brutality of apartheid. Activists used music to express their rage and frustration at the ruling government, often incurring the wrath of the oppressive regime with their protest songs. The dissenters used these songs to mobilise the masses while venting their sorrow at the injustices being suffered. These artists argue convincingly that the songs were integral to the struggle, providing an inestimable tole in the victory over apartheid. Performers and interviewees include: Thandi Modise, Vusi Mahlasela, Sibongile Khumalo, Duma KaNdlovu, Sibusiso Nxumalo, Lindiwe Zulu, Miriam Makeba, Abdullah Ibrahim, Sifiso Ntuli, Dolly Rathebe, and Hugh Masekela.

results.title: The Incredibles
results.creator_credit: Brad Bird, John Walker, Pixar Animation Studios and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Fun, fun, fun. That is the verdict on the latest ingenious animated feature from Pixar. Based around a family of ‘supers’ (aka superheroes) “The Incredibles” introduces Robert “Mr Incredible”, consigned to a life of mind-numbing boredom in suburbia who longs for his glory days as a world saving super hero. Spiritually crushed by a pen-pushing insurance claim job, Robert toils under the daily grind in the suburbs with loyal wife Helen (“Elastigirl”) and their three children. Bob’s zest for life is revived when he is called upon by the mysterious Mirage to perform some planet-saving assignments, but he is unwittingly drawn into confrontation with an old foe who seeks to bring all the Supers down. Bob must rely on his family to help when the situation becomes desperate and the audience gets to discover how super, these Supers really are. Features the voices of Craig T. Nelson, Holly Hunter, and Samuel L. Jackson.

results.title: Bad timing
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Jeremy Thomas, Rank Film Productions and Recorded Picture Company
results.brief_description: In Vienna a young woman (Theresa Russell), begins an affair with an American psychoanalyst (Art Garfunkel). The couple become sexually obsessed with one another, but his lack of trust, and his constant suspicions, lead her to alcohol, drugs and excess until one night she decides to take her own life. Or does he make the decision for her? A combination of thriller, detective story, and a study of alienation, “Bad Timing” both fascinates and disturbs. Technically the editing and production values of the film are superb. Also stars Denholm Elliott and Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Owning Mahowny
results.creator_credit: Richard Kwietniowski, Alessandro Camon, Andras Hamori, Seaton McLean, Alliance Atlantis, H2O Motion Pictures and Natural Nylon
results.brief_description: Impressive thriller about a mild-mannered, nebbish bank manager who, due to an obsessive gambling addiction, embezzles the bank where he works for several million dollars. Phillip Seymour Hoffman plays Dan Mahowny as a man whose self-delusions run deep, and whose desire to not only to remain in denial but also to keep his covert life secret from others, leads to extreme measures. What makes the film interesting is the way that Dan’s obsession and subsequent daring embezzlement builds slowly, spiralling out of his control. Hoffman depicts a man deluded but also conflicted by his choices that results in a great deal of suffering. Based on a true story.

results.title: The Idiots = Idioterne
results.creator_credit: Lars Von Trier, Vibeke Windelov, Dr TV, La Sept Cinema and Zentropa Entertainments2 ApS
results.brief_description: The second of three films (“Breaking the waves” and “Dancer in the dark”) directed by Von Trier, The Idiots too is created using a female protagonist put in a stressful situation and as a work, was created adhering to the rules of the Dogme 95 Manifesto. Karen (Bodil Jorgensen) is a lone diner in a restaurant when a mentally retarded man starts to disturb everyone and creates a scene. He, his female helper and other male simpleton coax the good-natured Karen to leave with them in a taxi. Once along for the ride Karen discovers that the men were simply pretending to avoid paying the bill. But being an “idiot” is not something the men do infrequently, in fact they are part of a small community living in a large house of men and women who all take part in the practice of ‘spazzing’ or role playing ‘idiots’ to lose inhibitions both social and sexual. The group leader Stoffer (Jens Albinus) pushes everyone to the limit to see just how far they are willing to take the practice into their personal lives beyond the select commune atmosphere of the house. Offensive or funny, dramatic or pathetic, this film about, by and for idiots will certainly challenge some viewers. Shown in competition at the 1998 Cannes Film Festival. WARNING: SEXUALLY EXPLICIT

results.title: Bertolt Brecht's Galileo = Galileo
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey, Ely Landau, Cinevision Ltee and The Ely Landau Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
From the American Film Theatre series of the 1970s comes the adaptation of the Bertolt Brecht play “Galileo”. Adapted for the screen by Barbara Bray and Joseph Losey from the English version by Charles Laughton. An all star cast tell the tale of 1600’s astronomer and scientist Galileo (Topol), his struggle with authorities and being ostracised - something which writer Brecht could identify having left Hollywood in 1947 to avoid having to testify before the House Un-American Activities Committee. Galileo comes up with the notion that the Earth revolves around the Sun - and desires astronomy become the much talked about subject of his era. He finds out about the telescope presents it as his invention to the Republic of Venice. The Papal astronomer then confirms Galileo’s discoveries much to the chagrin of the theologians of the church. So, for eight years he remained silent on his discoveries. Galileo then becomes a prisoner of the Inquisition until his death. Linking the scenes throughout are songs sung by a trio of choir boys and written captions that move the narrative through time to significant events in Galileo’s life. Cast includes Tom Conti, John Gielgud, Edward Fox, Colin Blakely, Georgia Brown, Margaret Leighton, Michael Lonsdale, Patrick Magee, John McEnery, Clive Revill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Losey, Ely Landau, Cinevision Ltee and The Ely Landau Organization

Adapted for the screen by Barbara Bray and Joseph Losey from the English version by Charles Laughton. An all star cast tell the tale of 1600’s astronomer and scientist Galileo (Topol), his struggle with authorities and being ostracised - something which writer Brecht could identify having left Hollywood in 1947 to avoid having to testify before the House Un-American Activities Committee. Galileo comes up with the notion that the Earth revolves around the Sun - and desires astronomy become the much talked about subject of his era. He finds out about the telescope presents it as his invention to the Republic of Venice. The Papal astronomer then confirms Galileo’s discoveries much to the chagrin of the theologians of the church. So, for eight years he remained silent on his discoveries. Galileo then becomes a prisoner of the Inquisition until his death. Linking the scenes throughout are songs sung by a trio of choir boys and written captions that move the narrative through time to significant events in Galileo’s life. Cast includes Tom Conti, John Gielgud, Edward Fox, Colin Blakely, Georgia Brown, Margaret Leighton, Michael Lonsdale, Patrick Magee, John McEnery, Clive Revill.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
From the American Film Theatre series of the 1970s comes the adaptation of the Bertolt Brecht play “Galileo”. Adapted for the screen by Barbara Bray and Joseph Losey from the English version by Charles Laughton. An all star cast tell the tale of 1600’s astronomer and scientist Galileo (Topol), his struggle with authorities and being ostracised - something which writer Brecht could identify having left Hollywood in 1947 to avoid having to testify before the House Un-American Activities Committee. Galileo comes up with the notion that the Earth revolves around the Sun - and desires astronomy become the much talked about subject of his era. He finds out about the telescope presents it as his invention to the Republic of Venice. The Papal astronomer then confirms Galileo’s discoveries much to the chagrin of the theologians of the church. So, for eight years he remained silent on his discoveries. Galileo then becomes a prisoner of the Inquisition until his death. Linking the scenes throughout are songs sung by a trio of choir boys and written captions that move the narrative through time to significant events in Galileo’s life. Cast includes Tom Conti, John Gielgud, Edward Fox, Colin Blakely, Georgia Brown, Margaret Leighton, Michael Lonsdale, Patrick Magee, John McEnery, Clive Revill.

results.title: The Last house on the left
results.creator_credit: Wes Craven, Sean S. Cunningham and Sean S. Cunningham Films
results.brief_description: Historically significant horror film by Wes Craven, is a rape-revenge drama that is unflinching in its depiction of murder, rape, sadism and violence. Despite the poor acting and cheap production values “Last house on the left” has a visceral impact that imparts a sense of dread and loathing upon the viewer. This film, at once derided for its brutality and yet praised for its daring, soon became a cult classic and was consequently, highly influential upon future horror-genre filmmakers. Along with “The Night of the living dead” (Romero, 1968) this film heralded the golden age of horror, ushering in an era of ‘realistic’ depiction of brutality in the American heartland. Contains graphic images and some scenes may disturb.
